page.title: 12Farming Part 1
page.content: Much of our area is arable farmland. Farm sizes are about 350 acres and the field sizes about 10 acres.The fields are now bigger than they used to be. They are bigger because all the hedgerows have been taken away to make more room for the larger machines. About 30 years ago the fields were worked by horses, but nowadays machinery is used because it is quicker and less men are needed. This made an effect on all the wildlife, so now all the farmers are planting small trees and bushes back in places where crops wouldn't grow, to encourage more animals to breed. Some of these are then shot for sport. The farmer's biggest enemies are pigeons, the weather, fungi, beetles and the bank manager. The major crops grown are barley, winter-wheat, sugar-beet, triticale, oil-seed rape and potatoes.
